title: Ksenia Sobchak
summary:
Ksenia Anatolyevna Sobchak (Russian: Ксения Анатольевна Собчак, BGN/PCGN: Kseniya Anatol'yevna Sobchak, GOST: Ksenija Anatolevna Sobčak, Russian pronunciation: ['ksʲenʲɪjə ɐnɐ'tolʲjɪvnə sɐpˈt͜ɕak]; born 5 November 1981) is a Russian public figure, TV anchor, journalist, socialite and actress. She is the younger daughter of the first democratically elected mayor of Saint Petersburg, Anatoly Sobchak, and the Russian senator Lyudmila Narusova. Sobchak became known to the wider public as a host of the reality show Dom-2 on the Russian channel TNT. Later she became an anchor at independent television channel Dozhd ("Rain"). As of January 2023, she hosts the television show Dok-Tok with Alexander Gordon.
Sobchak was the Civic Initiative's candidate for the 2018 Russian presidential election. At the age of 36, she became the youngest Russian presidential candidate in history.
